info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 21 at 11:46AM EST until February 23 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. * WHERE...Northern Herkimer and Hamilton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 10 PM EST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour at times this afternoon and into the early evening hours. Moderate to heavy snow Wednesday evening may mix with or occasionally change to a wintry mix of sleet and freezing rain late Wednesday night into Thursday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
